column6: and I will tell a story."Then all would cry
column8: and draw close to the fire. This meant that they were glad to hear the story. And as the flames leaped and chased one another along the fire trail, they would listen to these wonder stories of the Little People, of the trees and flowers, of birds, of animals, and men. When the storyteller had finished, he said, Na ho." This meant
column9: "It is the end."The earth was very young
column10: when the Iroquois first learned how everything came to be
column11: and just why it is that things are as they are. They told these wonderful things to their children
column12: and their children in turn told them to their children; and those children again in turn told them to theirs
column13: that these things might not be forgotten.
